head.citation-title: On 4-dimensional hypercomplex algebras in adaptive signal processing
head.abstracts: Â© 2019, Springer International Publishing AG, part of Springer Nature.The degree of diffusion of hypercomplex algebras in adaptive and non-adaptive filtering research topics is growing faster and faster. The debate today concerns the usefulness and the benefits of representing multidimensional systems by means of these complicated mathematical structures and the criterions of choice between one algebra or another. This paper proposes a simple comparison between two isodimensional algebras (quaternions and tessarines) and shows by simulations how different choices may determine the system performance. Some general information about both algebras is also supplied.
